phrases.phrase: By default, IP addresses lookups are cached in the database for performance reasons. Check this to bypass that and force use of the Maxmind database.
Allowed. Code appeared on an explicit approved list, so the user registration will be allowed.
Rejected (explicit). Code appeared on an explicit denied list and "Denied Action" is set to "Registration Denied", so the user registration will be rejected.

Rejected (EU). Code does not appear on any explicit approved or deny lists, but is indicated to be in the European Union and "Reject EU Registrations" is enabled, so the user registration will be rejected.
Moderated (explicit). Code appeared on an explicit denied list and "Denied Action" is set to "Registration Moderated", so the user registration will be placed in moderation.
Moderated (not listed). Code does not appear on any explicit approved or deny lists and the "Moderate Non-listed Countries" option is enabled, so the user registration will be placed in moderation.
No decision (allowed). Code does not appear on any explicit approved or deny lists and the "Moderate Non-listed Countries" option is not enabled, so the user registration will be allowed.
Maxmind database lookup returned code {code} for IP request [{ip}] with message: {message}
Error: Maxmind database configuration must be set in the options and the database must be downloaded. Use the Update Maxmind database tool to manually update it, or manually run the Cron task.

Simulate this country being in the European Union to determine what would happen to registration based on the "Reject EU Registrations" setting.

Does not perform any database lookups, nor does it validate whether this country is actually in the EU - used for testing configuration only.

Ignored if "Reject EU Registrations" option is not enabled.
- which is in the European Union
ISO code tester - would a user from this country be registered, rejected or moderated?
GeoIP lookup using Maxmind GeoLite2 database
Could not find Geo data for IP [{ip}]
Geoblock: registration IP country matched denied list
Geoblock: registration IP country in EU
Geoblock: registration IP country was neither allowed nor denied
Your registration has been rejected because we do not allow people from the European Union to use our site. Please contact the administrator for further information or assistance.
IP Address to query for geo information.

Enter a 2 character ISO country code to test against your Geoblock registration rules.

Does not query Maxmind database - simply matches text entered against configuration.
List of 2-character ISO codes for countries which are automatically approved (subject to other anti-spam checks the system might make). Separate multiple entries with commas, spaces or new lines.
How long (in days) to cache the IP Geo data in the database.
Path to where we will store the Maxmind GeoLite2 database, relative to the internal_data directory.
Full URL to database download source. You shouldn't need to change this unless Maxmind changes the URL.

List of 2-character ISO codes for countries which are denied automatic registration approval. The action taken (denied or moderated) depends on the setting below. Separate multiple entries with commas, spaces or new lines.

Enable this option to have registrations from any countries not in the approved or denied list automatically placed in moderation.

Disabling this option effectively approves registrations from any country NOT in the denied list and makes the Approved list redundant.

If Reject registrations from denied countries is unchecked, but Moderate non-listed countries is checked, the Denied list becomes redundant because registrations from any country not in the Approved list will automatically be placed in moderation.

Do not enable Moderate non-listed countries unless you are using at least one of the Approved or Denied lists - otherwise you effectively just place every registration in moderation - which you can do with a single XenForo setting with vastly improved performance!
Check this box to have registrations from denied countries rejected. Uncheck it to place them into moderation instead.

Enable this option to reject all registrations from countries identified as being in the EU. A message to this effect will be shown to the user.

This setting will be over-ridden by approve and denied lists - for example, GB is currently "in" the EU until Brexit, so add "GB" to the Approved list above to bypass this EU rejection setting and allow registrations from the UK. A user from a country on the explicit denied list will receive the standard "spam like behaviour" rejection message even if the address is in the EU.

Enable this option to turn on test mode - API calls are bypassed and instead the api will return a fixed IP address for testing purposes with attributes as selected. This is ideal for testing on a local development machine where the IP address is private and the API calls always return an unusable ISO Code.

The IP address returned is always "10.0.0.1" and the ISO Code is always "XX".

Usage: Turn on test mode, place the "XX" ISO Code in the Approved or Denied country codes lists and then register a new user account to see what effect the settings will have on registration.
Geoblock Registrations using Maxmind GeoLite2 Database
